sen.j: 巨勢 人（こせ の ひと、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: KOSE no Hito, whose age at death was unknown, was a historical figure lived in the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 人物→personality; Personal Profileは、この場合ふさわしくないと考えました。
sen.e: OKISOME no Usagi (year of birth and death unknown) was a historical figure lived during Japan's Asuka Period.
sen.cmt: 生没年不明の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: OKISOME no Usagi (year of birth and death unknown) was a historical figure lived during Japan's Asuka Period.

sen.j: 名は比等、毘登とも書く。
sen.e: His name Hito, "人," was also written as "比等" or "毘登."
His name Hito, "人," was also written as "比等" or "毘登."
His name Hito, "人," was also written as "比等" or "毘登."

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は臣。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Omi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Omi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Omi.

sen.j: 小徳位巨勢大海の子。
sen.e: He was a child of Shotokui (the second grade of "Twelve Grades of Cap Rank") KOSE no Oama.
He was a child of Shotokui (the second grade of "Twelve Grades of Cap Rank") KOSE no Oama.
He was a child of Shotokui (the second grade of "Twelve Grades of Cap Rank") KOSE no Oama.

sen.j: 天智天皇に仕えて御史大夫に昇り、672年の壬申の乱で大友皇子（弘文天皇）側の将軍となった。
sen.e: He served Emperor Tenchi and promoted to Gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling the officials) and was a shogun of the army of Otomo no Oji (Prince Otomo), who later became Emperor Kobun, during the Jinshin War in 672.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served Emperor Tenchi and was promoted to Gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling the officials), and during the Jinshin War of 672, he became shogun of the army of Otomo no Oji (Prince Otomo), who later became Emperor Kobun.
sen.cmt: 原文通りの語順にしました。
sen.e: He served Emperor Tenchi and was promoted to Gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling the officials), and during the Jinshin War of 672, he became shogun of the army of Otomo no Oji (Prince Otomo), who later became Emperor Kobun.

sen.j: しかし、内訌をおこして敗れ、乱後は流罪になった。
sen.e: However, he was involved in an internal strife and lost; after the war, he was exiled.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he was involved in an internal strife and lost; after the war, he was exiled.
However, he was involved in an internal strife and lost; after the war, he was exiled.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代の有力氏族巨勢氏の一族小徳位巨勢大海（大紫位左大臣巨勢徳多の兄弟）の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as a child of Shotokui KOSE no Oama, a member of the powerful KOSE clan, whose brother was Daishii (Fifth Rank) Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) KOSE no Tokuta in the Asuka Period.
He was born as a child of Shotokui KOSE no Oama, a member of the powerful KOSE clan, whose brother was Daishii (Fifth Rank) Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) KOSE no Tokuta in the Asuka Period.
He was born as a child of Shotokui KOSE no Oama, a member of the powerful KOSE clan, whose brother was Daishii (Fifth Rank) Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) KOSE no Tokuta in the Asuka Period.

sen.j: 巨勢人は、天智天皇10年（671年）1月2日、蘇我赤兄とともに天皇の前に進み、賀正のことを奏した。
sen.e: KOSE no Hito and SOGA no Akae spoke ceremonial Ｎew Year's greetings in front of Emperor Tenchi in January 2, 671.
sen.cmt: 「賀正のことを奏した」という意味がはっきりわかりません。
sen.e: KOSE no Hito and SOGA no Akae spoke ceremonial New Year's greetings in front of Emperor Tenchi in January 2, 671 (old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: ここで新暦に変換してしまうとＮew Year's greetingsの意味が伝わらなくなるので、旧暦であることを示しました。よって以下も日付は旧暦のままです。
sen.e: KOSE no Hito and SOGA no Akae spoke ceremonial New Year's greetings in front of Emperor Tenchi in January 2, 671 (old lunar calendar).

sen.j: このとき位は大錦下であった。
sen.e: His rank at this time was Daikinge.
His rank at this time was Daikinge.
His rank at this time was Daikinge.

sen.j: 1月5日、蘇我果安・紀大人とともに御史大夫になった。
sen.e: He, SOGA no Hatayasu, and KI no Ushi were assigned to Gyoshi taifu on January 5.
He, SOGA no Hatayasu, and KI no Ushi were assigned to Gyoshi taifu on January 5.
He, SOGA no Hatayasu, and KI no Ushi were assigned to Gyoshi taifu on January 5.

sen.j: 同日に大友皇子が太政大臣、蘇我赤兄が左大臣、中臣金が右大臣に任命された。
sen.e: Prince Otomo was assgined to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), SOGA no Akae was assigned to Sadaijin, and NAKATOMI no Kane was assigned to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) on the same day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Prince Otomo was assgined to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), SOGA no Akae was assigned to Sadaijin, and NAKATOMI no Kane was assigned to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) on the same day.
Prince Otomo was assgined to Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), SOGA no Akae was assigned to Sadaijin, and NAKATOMI no Kane was assigned to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) on the same day.

sen.j: 御史大夫はこれに次ぐ重職であった。
sen.e: The rank of Gyoshi taifu was immediately below these ranks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The rank of Gyoshi taifu was immediately below these ranks.
The rank of Gyoshi taifu was immediately below these ranks.

sen.j: 同年11月23日に、大友皇子を含めて上に挙げた六人の重臣は、内裏の西殿の織物仏の前で誓盟を交わした。
sen.e: Prince Otomo and his six chief retainers exchanged vows in front of the textile depicting Buddha in the west wing of the Imperial Palace on November 23 of the same year.
sen.cmt: 「織物仏」の意味がはっきりわからないので、「仏の絵が描かれた織物」という意味に訳しました。
sen.e: Prince Otomo and his six chief retainers exchanged vows in front of the textile depicting Buddha in the west wing of the Imperial Palace on November 23 of the same year.
Prince Otomo and his six chief retainers exchanged vows in front of the textile depicting Buddha in the west wing of the Imperial Palace on November 23 of the same year.

sen.j: まず大友皇子が手に香炉をとって立ち下記のように誓った。
sen.e: First, Otomo no Oji stood up holding a koro (incense burner) in hand and pledged as below.
First, Otomo no Oji stood up holding a koro (incense burner) in hand and pledged as below.
First, Otomo no Oji stood up holding a koro (incense burner) in hand and pledged as below.

sen.j: 「六人心を同じくして天皇の詔を奉じる。もし違うことがあれば必ず天罰を被る」
sen.e: 'The six of us, acting as one, promise to obey Emperor's orders. The heaven shall punish us if the promise were broken. '
'The six of us, acting as one, promise to obey Emperor's orders. The heaven shall punish us if the promise were broken. '
'The six of us, acting as one, promise to obey Emperor's orders. The heaven shall punish us if the promise were broken. '

sen.j: あとの五人も香炉を手にして次々に立ち、下記のように泣きながら言った。
sen.e: Then the rest of five members with tears in their eyes stood up holding a koro in hand one after the other and pledged as below.
Then the rest of five members with tears in their eyes stood up holding a koro in hand one after the other and pledged as below.
Then the rest of five members with tears in their eyes stood up holding a koro in hand one after the other and pledged as below.

sen.j: 「臣ら六人、殿下に従って天皇の詔を奉じる。」
sen.e: 'We, the six of us, promise to follow Emperor and obey his orders.'
'We, the six of us, promise to follow Emperor and obey his orders.'
'We, the six of us, promise to follow Emperor and obey his orders.'

sen.j: 「もし違うことがあれば四天王が打つ。」
sen.e: 'Shitennou shall strike us down if the promise were broken.'
Shitenno (four guardian kings) shall strike us down if the promise were broken.'
sen.cmt: 四天王の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: Shitenno (four guardian kings) shall strike us down if the promise were broken.'

sen.j: 「天神地祇も誅罰する。」
sen.e: 'The gods of heaven and earth shall punish us.'
'The gods of heaven and earth shall punish us.'
'The gods of heaven and earth shall punish us.'

sen.j: 「三十三天はこのことを証し知れ。」
sen.e: 'Sanjusanten (the 33 heavens) shall see that the punishment shall be real.'
Let Sanjusanten (the 33 heavens) bear witness.'
Let Sanjusanten (the 33 heavens) bear witness.'

sen.j: 「子孫が絶え、家門が滅びる。」
sen.e: 'Our family lineages shall die and cease to exist.'
'Our family lineages shall die and cease to exist.'
'Our family lineages shall die and cease to exist.'

sen.j: 11月29日に五人の臣は大友皇子を奉じて天皇の前で誓った。
sen.e: The five retainers obeyed Otomo no Oji and made an oath in front of Emperor on November 29.
The five retainers obeyed Otomo no Oji and made an oath in front of Emperor on November 29.
The five retainers obeyed Otomo no Oji and made an oath in front of Emperor on November 29.

sen.j: 以上の『日本書紀』の記述では「天皇の詔」の具体的内容が明らかにされていない。
sen.e: The above accounts in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) did not include the detailed contents of 'Emperor's orders.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The above accounts in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) did not include the detailed contents of 'Emperor's orders.'
The above accounts in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) did not include the detailed contents of 'Emperor's orders.'

sen.j: しかし、一般には大友皇子を次の天皇に擁立することと理解されている。
sen.e: However, according to the commonly accepted theory, Emperor Tenchi ordered the retainers to back up Otomo no Oji to be the next emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, according to the commonly accepted theory, Emperor Tenchi ordered the retainers to back up Otomo no Oji to be the next emperor.
However, according to the commonly accepted theory, Emperor Tenchi ordered the retainers to back up Otomo no Oji to be the next emperor.

sen.j: 29日にも五人の臣は大友皇子を奉じて天智天皇の前で盟した。
sen.e: The five retainers obeyed Otomo no Oji and made an oath in front of Emperor Tenchi again on November 29.
sen.cmt: 3行前の繰り返しになるので、必要ないかと思われます。
sen.e: The five retainers obeyed Otomo no Oji and made an oath in front of Emperor Tenchi again on November 29.
The five retainers obeyed Otomo no Oji and made an oath in front of Emperor Tenchi again on November 29.

sen.j: 内容は不明だが、前の誓いと同じだと思われる。
sen.e: The details were unknown; however it was probably the same oath as before.
The details were unknown; however it was probably the same oath as before.
The details were unknown; however it was probably the same oath as before.

sen.j: 12月3日に天智天皇が崩御。
sen.e: Emperor Tenchi died on December 3.
Emperor Tenchi died on December 3.
Emperor Tenchi died on December 3.

sen.j: 既に吉野宮に去っていた天武天皇は、翌年の6月22日に反乱に踏みきった。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu, who had already moved to Yoshinomiya, decided to go ahead with the war on June 22.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu, who had already moved to Yoshinomiya, decided to go ahead with the war on June 22 of the following year.
sen.cmt: 「翌年の」の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu, who had already moved to Yoshinomiya, decided to go ahead with the war on June 22 of the following year.

sen.j: 美濃国の不破郡に兵を集めてそこに移った。
sen.e: He gathered his troops in Fuwa-gun in Mino Province and moved there himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He gathered his troops in Fuwa-gun in Mino Province and moved there himself.
He gathered his troops in Fuwa-gun in Mino Province and moved there himself.

sen.j: 巨勢比等（人）は山部王・蘇我果安とともに、数万の兵力を率いて大海人皇子を討つべく不破に向けて進発した。
sen.e: KOSE no Hito, Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe), and SOGA no Hatayasu lead tens of thousands of soldiers and advanced to Fuwa to defeat Oama no Miko (Prince Oama).
KOSE no Hito, Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe), and SOGA no Hatayasu led tens of thousands of soldiers and advanced to Fuwa to defeat Oama no Miko (Prince Oama).
sen.cmt: leadを ledに訂正しました。
sen.e: KOSE no Hito, Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe), and SOGA no Hatayasu led tens of thousands of soldiers and advanced to Fuwa to defeat Oama no Miko (Prince Oama).

sen.j: しかし7月2日頃、犬上川の岸に陣を敷いたとき、果安と比等は山部王を殺した。
sen.e: However, Hatayasu and Hito killed Yamabe no Okimi around July 2 when they had set up a camp on the bank of Inugami River.
However, Hatayasu and Hito killed Yamabe no Okimi around July 2 when they had set up a camp on the bank of Inugami River.
However, Hatayasu and Hito killed Yamabe no Okimi around July 2 when they had set up a camp on the bank of Inugami River.

sen.j: その理由は『日本書紀』に記されていない。
sen.e: The reason for his action was not written in "Nihonshoki."
The reason for his action was not written in "Nihonshoki."
The reason for his action was not written in "Nihonshoki."

sen.j: 混乱のため進軍が滞り、果安は帰ってから首を刺して死んだ。
sen.e: The troops stopped advancing because of the confusion and Hatayasu committed suicide by piercing his own neck upon his return (to ?).
sen.cmt: (to ?) 「帰ってから」とあるが、どこに帰ったのかわからないので、曖昧になってしまいました。
sen.e: The troops stopped advancing because of the confusion and Hatayasu committed suicide by piercing his own neck upon his return.
sen.cmt: 原文が曖昧なので、returnで文を切りました。
sen.e: The troops stopped advancing because of the confusion and Hatayasu committed suicide by piercing his own neck upon his return.

sen.j: この前後の比等の行動は不明であり、指揮を執り続けたのかどうかもはっきりしない。
sen.e: Hito's actions before and after the incident were unknown and it was unclear whether he was in command of the troops then.
Hito's actions before and after the incident were unknown and it was unclear whether he was in command of the troops then.
Hito's actions before and after the incident were unknown and it was unclear whether he was in command of the troops then.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が大海人皇子の勝利に帰すと、乱後大納言巨勢臣比等と子孫は配流された（『日本書紀』）。
sen.e: The Jinshin War ended in Oama no Miko's victory; after the war, Dainagon (Major Counselor) KOSE no Hito and his descendants were exiled ("Nihonshoki").
The Jinshin War ended in Oama no Miko's victory; after the war, Dainagon (Major Counselor) KOSE no Hito and his descendants were exiled ("Nihonshoki").
The Jinshin War ended in Oama no Miko's victory; after the war, Dainagon (Major Counselor) KOSE no Hito and his descendants were exiled ("Nihonshoki").

sen.j: 結局内訌の性質はわからないながら、少なくとも比等の側に大海人皇子に靡くような行動はなかったと考えられている。
sen.e: The nature of the internal strife was unknown; however, it is believed that Hito didn't intend to gain favor from Oama no Miko.
The nature of the internal strife was unknown; however, it is believed that Hito didn't intend to gain favor from Oama no Miko.
The nature of the internal strife was unknown; however, it is believed that Hito didn't intend to gain favor from Oama no Miko.

sen.j: ここにある「大納言」は、日本書紀の編者が御史大夫を編纂当時の官職名に改めたものと考えられる。
sen.e: Hito's title, Gyoshitaifu, is written as 'Dainagon ' because an editor of "Nihonshoki" substituted the new titles used at the time of compilation for the old ones.
Hito's title, Gyoshitaifu, is written as 'Dainagon ' because an editor of "Nihonshoki" substituted the new titles used at the time of compilation for the old ones.
Hito's title, Gyoshitaifu, is written as 'Dainagon ' because an editor of "Nihonshoki" substituted the new titles used at the time of compilation for the old ones.

sen.j: 子に巨勢奈弖麻呂と巨勢郎女があった。
sen.e: Hito had two children, KOSE no Nademaro and KOSE no Iratsume.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hito had two children, KOSE no Nademaro and KOSE no Iratsume.
Hito had two children, KOSE no Nademaro and KOSE no Iratsume.

sen.j: 奈弖麻呂は後に官人として大納言にまで昇進し、巨勢郎女は大伴安麻呂と結婚した。
sen.e: Nademaro was a government official and reached a position of Dainagon in later years and Iratsume was married to OTOMO no Yasumaro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nademaro was a government official and reached a position of Dainagon in later years and Iratsume was married to OTOMO no Yasumaro.
Nademaro was a government official and reached a position of Dainagon in later years and Iratsume was married to OTOMO no Yasumaro.

sen.j: 安麻呂は壬申の乱で大海人皇子について活躍した人物だが、結婚と乱や配流との時間的前後関係は不明である。
sen.e: Yasumaro fought and had a great success in the Jinshin War on Oama no Miko's side; however, the chronological order of his marriage to Iratsume, the Jinshin War, and KOSE family's exile is unknown.
Yasumaro fought and had a great success in the Jinshin War on Oama no Miko's side; however, the chronological order of his marriage to Iratsume, the Jinshin War, and KOSE family's exile is unknown.
Yasumaro fought and had a great success in the Jinshin War on Oama no Miko's side; however, the chronological order of his marriage to Iratsume, the Jinshin War, and KOSE family's exile is unknown.
